title: Institutional Learning Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Search for Common Ground
Interview Descriptions: Interview process consisted in 3 interviews + 1 written test. Written test was 5 hours long and was sent to me one hour in advance than agreed. Also, the recruiter didn't say anything in advance about the duration of the written test. Once I completed the second interview (which was supposed to be the last), the recruiter told me that I Will have to do another one, he schedule the date one day After and gave no other options saying that the interviewer Will only be available at that date and then Will go on vacation. Once I said I Will not be available at that time, the recruiter disappeared and contacted me again after a while. They disclosed their salary only at the very end of the process, when they told me I was selected; I had to ask them two times in a row about it. Time duration of the process: preliminary interview -30 minutes; written technical test -5 hours; technical interview -1 hour; technical interview -1 hour. Total time: 7 hours 30 minutes, which Is really a lot! In general, the recruitment process was too long, very shady, lacked many informations and was very one-sided. These were too big red flags for me and I declined their offer. I would really suggest to avoid this organization: potential employees deserve respect and should not be available 24h on 24h at their own   will. Very very negative experience.
Interview Questions: Why do u want to work for us?

title: Officer, Program Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Search for Common Ground in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: I got an email Tuesday night before Thanksgiving offering a 30-minute screener, with time options on either Thanksgiving or the day after. Recruiter sounded really positive but never followed up and ignored my email a week later. On Christmas Eve I received an email stating that the interview process was a bit delayed, but never heard anything after.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working at Search for Common Ground? What experience do you have with budget management and software for keeping track of budgets?

title: Human Resources Generalist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Search for Common Ground
Interview Descriptions: The process here was... Not good, which was sad because this was, I thought, my dream job. I applied in April... finally heard back 1 month later to schedule an interview with a recruiter, which was fairly generic hiring questions. It took nearly another month to hear back after that, which was just to say they weren't ready to schedule second interviews because too many people were on vacation. FINALLY had the second interview scheduled in June, two months after the first interview, with a few members of the HR staff, and it was more HR specific questions this time. I thought the interview went really well. At the end, they let me know they were at the very beginning of the process of second interviews so it would be a while before I heard anything... and I was patient. So patient that two entire months went by without a word, until I finally reached out to the recruiter myself to request a status update and found out I just didn't get it and got a "oh whoops thought we contacted you already!" It's 2022 and email is free, if people can take leave from their current positions and give you 1-2 hours of their time for multiple interviews, it seems like you can at least show them the respect of sending a timely rejection letter.
Interview Questions: How do you think this position aligns with the values of Search for Common Ground?

title: MEAL Officer Interview
